name: Collisions
description: Collisions is a relaxing puzzle game based on timing, logic and anticipation. Explore a world of surreal machines and uncover the story behind the mysterious object looming above the horizon.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista+ Processor: 1 GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Storage: 100 MB available space
recommended_requirements: Additional Notes: Requires a mouse or touchscreen

reviews.review_text: Mediocre puzzle game with a nice graphics theme, but unfortunately things blend together too well at times, so you can't always see what the interactive components are. I liked the puzzles that reminded me of the board game, Downfall, with rotating cogs that you drop the ball into, but there were only a couple of those. The puzzles are a mix of skill, timing, and luck... mostly luck. A few of them are fun and well designed, some are okay, and the rest rely too much on luck and involve too much waiting between attempts. Overall, it feels like a good start, but it needs refining before I'd recommend spending time with it.

A too-simplistic physics puzzle which is short and often relies on chance (someone compared some of the levels to a pachinko machine - which is a fair description)  It looks and sounds nice enough and there's some interesting ideas, but the lack of content and annoyance of 'take your chances' elements killed it for me.  Note: The game has a 'star' system for first-time solutions but that only applies to SOME of the levels - I assume the others are so random it makes no sense to offer that?  It's hard to recommend on that basis - I found it more frustrating than anything else  p.s. I did 12 of the 50 puzzles and I'd not played long enough to leave a review at that point (less than 5 mins) - so there's well under an hour of content here...

Great little puzzle game! Nice physics and cool setting, controls so easy that you could take break from game for months and have no trouble going back to it! Little bit too short for my liking but still fantastic game.
Pretty much a flash game you found on the internet 5 years ago..
I do not really like puzzle games, and I got this in a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ code bundle. Still, was pretty fun. Extremely short, though; beat it in an hour.
